messages.message: A lot of insurance claims have pictures - damage on a home, drawing of a car accident, picture of a damaged car etc. With GPT4o, it would be really cool, as part of a single flow to extract a visual entity like that, and then able to query it. A common car insurance claim have people both draw and explain a car accident situation. If the model can explain the drawing, we could also compare the drawing with the written explanation and make inferences whether these match / make sense.
Related: VRSF is also interested in being able to reason over policy docs that have visual flowcharts. cc: @leila.tan @Kaustubh (KD)
@Kerry @Sławek Biel @Hari once we integrate gpt4o, let's look into doing some testing with the visual capabilities. Good hackathon idea?
We have this feature on the top at  AXA France needs. If we have this feature they will be amazed cc @Léo
@Daniel Campo are they actively looking for this? What's the usecase? Could you create a pfr to help us track? go/pfr
